page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: This area is almost entirely South Downs,with a steep slope at the northern edge of the squares and a gradual slope down towards the southern edge.The highest point is over 235 metres high.The area is mainly Downland but it is criss- crossed with bridle ways and footpaths. The largest settlement is Pyecombe with fewer than 50 houses. There are many scattered farms producing mainly grain crops. The main railway links London with Brighton as does the A23 road which runs east and south through the squares.Heavy traffic commuters use this stretch of road.The Downs is also used recreationally with activities such as walking,horse-riding and golf. Picnics,kite-flying and in winter sledging are popular.
